DataElement.preferredName: Health Assessment Questionnaire Disability Index Past Week How Well Doing Health Rating Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated rating of how well they were doing related to their health over the past week, using a visual analogue scale where zero represents very well and 100 represents very poor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Health Assessment Questionnaire Disability Index Questionnaire Past Week How Well Doing Health Rating
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized questionnaire developed by James F. Fries in 1983, which is originally used to measure outcome in patients with Rheumatoid Arthritis. It has also been applied to patients with HIV/AIDS and in studies of normal aging. The HAQ-DI is a generic instrument which focuses on self-reported, patient-oriented outcome measures. The questionnaire contains 8 categories of 46 items; dressing and grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reaching, grip, and activities. A 0-3 grade scale is used, where grade 0 represents category performed without any difficulty and grade 3 represents category performed with the greatest difficulty (unable to do)._The most recent week, including today._A question about how well an individual is doing as related to their health.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Health Assessment Questionnaire Disability Index Questionnaire
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standardized questionnaire developed by James F. Fries in 1983, which is originally used to measure outcome in patients with Rheumatoid Arthritis. It has also been applied to patients with HIV/AIDS and in studies of normal aging. The HAQ-DI is a generic instrument which focuses on self-reported, patient-oriented outcome measures. The questionnaire contains 8 categories of 46 items; dressing and grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reaching, grip, and activities. A 0-3 grade scale is used, where grade 0 represents category performed without any difficulty and grade 3 represents category performed with the greatest difficulty (unable to do).

Concepts.longName: Health Assessment Questionnaire Disability Index With Pain Visual Analog Scale Questionnaire
Concepts.definition: A standardized questionnaire developed by James F. Fries in 1983, which is originally used to measure outcome in patients with Rheumatoid Arthritis. It has also been applied to patients with HIV/AIDS and in studies of normal aging. The HAQ-DI With VAS is a generic instrument which focuses on self-reported, patient-oriented outcome measures. The questionnaire contains 8 categories of 46 items; dressing and grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reaching, grip, and activities. A 0-3 grade scale is used, where grade 0 represents category performed without any difficulty and grade 3 represents category performed with the greatest difficulty (unable to do).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard for the subjective scoring of pain that ranges from 0 (no pain) to 100 (severe pain).

ReferenceDocuments.name: Your HEALTH: Please rate how
ReferenceDocuments.description: Your HEALTH: Please rate how well you are doing on a scale of 0 to 100 (0 represents very well and 100 represents very poor health), please record the number below.
